intro: Westringia amabilis, commonly known as the sweet everlasting or sweet everlasting heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant is evergreen and typically grows in well-drained soils, often in coastal or sandy habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry conditions. Westringia amabilis is also known for its long-lasting flowers, which remain intact for extended periods, giving it its common name.
